supporting_spans: He joined the Indian-Ocean pirate crew Black Tide and, thanks to his sailing skill, became second mate within three years; while looting an East-Indiaman he found among the prisoners the colonial officer who had framed his father and personally cut the man’s throat, earning the pirate nickname “Blood Raven.”
He was a sailor on the yacht Duncan, which was on its way to the Argentine shore. He was armed with a revolver and was part of the group that attacked Glenarvan.
contradicting_spans: Ayrton suddenly sprang to his feet. In his hand was a revolver. A report was heard; and Glenarvan fell, struck by a bullet.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence directly contradicts the claim that Tom Ayrton/Ben Joyce became second mate within three years and earned the nickname 'Blood Raven' after looting an East-Indiaman.

analysis.claim_text: He joined the Indian-Ocean pirate crew Black Tide and, thanks to his sailing skill, became second mate within three years; while looting an East-Indiaman he found among the prisoners the colonial officer who had framed his father and personally cut the man’s throat, earning the pirate nickname “Blood Raven.”

sub_claims.text: He joined the Indian-Ocean pirate crew Black Tide.
Thanks to his sailing skill, he became second mate within three years.
While looting an East-Indiaman he found among the prisoners the colonial officer who had framed his father and personally cut the man’s throat, earning the pirate nickname ‘Blood Raven.’

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence directly contradicts the claim that Tom Ayrton/Ben Joyce became second mate within three years and earned the nickname 'Blood Raven' after looting an East-Indiaman.
